title: Liverpool star Divock Origi reveals Belgium squad play Guess Who? to pass the time while on international duty
text:
EFL GUESS WHO? Liverpool star Divock Origi reveals Belgium squad play Guess Who? to pass the time while on international duty 
Striker close pals with Kevin De Bruyne growing up in Genk and uses Thierry Henry as inspiration By TOM SHEEN Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LIVERPOOL striker Divock Origi has revealed that the Belgium squad play board games to pass the time on international duty. 
The Red Devils’ favourite is Guess Who? – which pits players against each other to try and find the mystery face. AP:Associated Press Divock Origi revealed the Belgium squad plays Guess Who? while on international duty Hasbro 3 The popular game sees players ask yes or no questions before trying to guess which card the opponent has 
Origi added that the close-knit nature of the Belgium squad has been replicated at club level by Jurgen Klopp. 
The 21-year-old also revealed that Manchester City rival Kevin De Bruyne – against whom he plays today – was a big inspiration growing up. 
Although De Bruyne is four years older, both players were at the Genk academy at the same time and would spend hours playing together as the pair lived around the corner from each other. 
He told the Daily Mail : “There would be three or four other kids involved. 
“Wednesday was always our day. On a Wednesday in Belgium, you have a half-day in school. You finish at 12 and then we would train at 6pm. We would just play football, over and over. “Kevin is four years older than me. I saw him breaking through into the first team and he gave me inspiration. 
“The digs where he lived were 600 metres from me. I had a very big garden with a goal in my house, I would tell him and a few others to come over. 
“You could see the skill then.” Getty Images 3 Origi has give goals in his last seven Liverpool games 
Origi also said that new Belgium assistant coach Thierry Henry is proving a great help as he continues to develop after a stuttering first season at Anfield. 
Jurgen Klopp is clearly a fan of the forward and he already has four Premier League goals this season after scoring just five in the whole of the last campaign. 
In all competitions he has five goals in his last seven. 
“He has always believed in me,” added Origi. 
“I don’t look back often but when I do, I can see how he has helped me. 
“That is the one thing with him. He always looks forward. He always pushes you.” New Year's Eve Premier League match preview including Liverpool v Man City
